results.title: Joan Kirner
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Best known for her appointment as Australia’s first female Premier in Victoria in 1990, Joan Kirner has a long history of working towards gender equality and social justice spanning five decades. In this intimate bio-doc, Kirner shares stories of the challenges and motivators of leadership in community and political spheres. Kirner has been has been pivotal in the areas of education reform, the formation of the first Landcare groups, affirmative action for women in government and was co-founder of EMILY’s List.

results.title: In a knot
results.brief_description: ‘Warburton, which is practically my life.’ A sparse story, fairly poetic, about her stress and anxiety and fighting with her family. Amazing photos - from a light plane looking over the ‘Black Saturday’ affected areas.

results.title: Jeanette Powell
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: In 1996 Powell became the first female to represent The Nationals in the Victorian Government when she was elected as the Member for the North Eastern Province in the Legislative Council. Powell’s political career began as a Councillor for the Shire of Shepparton. Powell has served as Shepparton Shire President, was appointed a commissioner with the Shire of Campaspe in 1994 and in 2002 Powell was elected as the State Member for Shepparton District. Powell is currently the Shadow Minister for Local Government and the Shadow Minister for Aboriginal Affairs.

results.title: In conversation with Al Alcorn
results.brief_description:
Al Alcorn talks with Swinburne University’s Christian McCrea about the origin of Atari, the culture from which it emerged and the legacy of ‘Pong’.
Interviewed on 07 March 2008 as part of the ‘Game On’ exhibition.

results.title: Game Masters: Yu Suzuki interview
results.creator_credit: Richard Greenhalgh, ACMI Content Development and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Yu Suzuki talks about his body of work which is one of the most diverse in the industry, ranging from the adrenalin rushes of his early arcade hits ‘Space Harrier’ (1985) and ‘Hang-On’ (1985) to the console adventure epic ‘Shenmue’ (1999).

As the pioneer of immersive, full-body arcade games, Suzuki has never been afraid to explore fantasy, reality and every shade of virtual experience in between.

In 1999, Suzuki moved away from arcades to create ‘Shenmue’ (1999), an open-world adventure for the Dreamcast. ‘Shenmue’ was recognised at the time as one of the most expansive and detailed videogames ever made; it pioneered the ‘open city’ subgenre of open-world games.

NB: Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Game Masters: Yuji Naka interview
results.creator_credit: Mike Kenneally, ACMI Content Development, ACMI Media Studio and ACMI
results.brief_description:
Yuji Naka is a videogame designer and programmer, best known as the former head of Sonic Team, where he was the lead programmer of the original ‘Sonic the Hedgehog’. Naka reveals his initial desire to make arcade games and the influence that Yu Suzuki has had on his career as a programmer. Since 2006 he has been the head of Prope, an independent game company he founded after leaving SEGA.
Yuji gives great insights into the development and creation of ‘Sonic the Hedgehog 1 and 2’, ‘Nights into Dreams’ and ‘Chu Chu Rocket’.
NB: This interview was conducted in Yuji Naka’s native language of Japanese and features English subtitles. Interviewer is neither seen nor heard onscreen.

results.title: Gracia Baylor
results.creator_credit: Helen Simondson, Lisetta Moscardo and ACMI
results.brief_description: Gracia Baylor was the first woman President of the Shire of Healesville, now Yarra Ranges Shire Council, and one of the first two women to be elected to the Victorian Legislative Council. Gracia has been an active leader of women’s organisations, including President of the National Council of Women (NCW) of Victoria 1990-93 and President of NCW Australia 1997-2000. In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.
results.description: Gracia Baylor was the first woman President of the Shire of Healesville, now Yarra Ranges Shire Council, and one of the first two women to be elected to the Victorian Legislative Council. Gracia has been an active leader of women’s organisations, including President of the National Council of Women (NCW) of Victoria 1990-93 and President of NCW Australia 1997-2000. In 1999, Gracia was made a Member of the Order of Australia (AM) in recognition of her services to Parliament and women’s affairs. She is a member of two Federal Government Advisory Committees.

results.title: In conversation with Graham Leader
results.brief_description:
‘Heartworn Highways’ (1981) captures singer-songwriters such as Townes Van Zandt, Guy Clark, Rodney Crowell, a young Steve Earle and Steve Young living and performing in the heart of pure Country.
Producer Graham Leader talks about the genesis of the documentary ‘Heartworn Highways’. Interview recorded as part of ‘Drifters, Dreamers and Cowboys’ 24 November 2008.
